Basic and custom registries
The registry settings of the object type allow editing its
visual
according to individual preferences of the System user, which helps to facilitate convenient interaction with the platform elements.
A single data type registry can have different sets of settings, so the user can work with the same registry to accomplish different tasks.
Each object type has a default registry. Within the platform, it is possible to create and configure two types of registry:
basic registry
;
custom registry
.
The custom registry is created from the basic registry, which allows to automatically apply changes in the basic registry settings to the inherited custom registry.
Access permissions
Saving settings
Saving registry settings (for example, a specified
sorting
or
data filtering
) is performed by clicking the
button:
If there is no basic registry (there are no registries available by clicking the
button), but the user has permissions to create instances of the "Basic registry settings" [SYS_REGISTRY] type, the basic registry will be created.
If the user has permissions to edit the current registry, the settings will be saved in the current registry.
If the user does not have permissions to edit the current registry and has no permissions to create instances of the "Custom registry settings" [SYS_REGISTRY_CUSTOM] type, a custom registry will be created.
If the user does not have permissions to edit the current registry and create instances of the basic and custom registries, the settings will not be saved.
Viewing and creating a registry
The
button is used to view existing registries and create new ones..
The button display is adjusted in the
registry control panel settings
.
Access to the drop-down list is provided with
permissions
to "Read" the "Basic registry settings" [SYS_REGISTRY] and/or "Custom registry" [SYS_REGISTRY_CUSTOM] object types.
To create or copy an existing registry, the user must have
permissions
to "Create instances" of the "Basic registry settings" [SYS_REGISTRY] and/or "Custom registry" [SYS_REGISTRY_CUSTOM]  object types.
If the user has permissions to only one registry and does not have permissions to "Create instances" of the "Basic registry settings" [SYS_REGISTRY] or "Custom registry" [SYS_REGISTRY_CUSTOM] object types, the drop-down list will be unavailable.
Basic registry
A basic type registry is a set of registry settings set up in the System based on the default object type.
The user is able not only to customize the existing registry, but also to create copies of it, preserving all attributes and other elements of the base registry for correct display of information according to specific tasks.
Initially, the default registry is installed in the new object type. Based on it, user can create the first basic registry by clicking on the
button, which opens the modal window
settings
of the basic registry.
Save changes by clicking on the
button.
To create a copy of the basic registry, display a list of existing registries using the
button, and after selecting the basic registry, click on the
.
In the modal window that opens, just fill in the basic information:
name of the created copy;
link to the object type the copy will be generated based on (can be filled in automatically).
In addition, the user will be able to configure the display of columns in the registry and other settings for displaying and filtering
registry
instances).
After making the necessary changes, save them using the
button and click on the "Ok" button.
The created copy of the basic registry will be automatically displayed on the user’s screen.
Copies of the basic registry take on a similar level in the hierarchical list of existing registries.
To be able to edit attribute values directly in the object type registry, open the registry settings, go to the "Display styles" tab and activate the "Use default editing mode" setting switch
Once this is done, it is possible to change the attribute values in the registry by clicking once with the left mouse button on the field to be edited
Creating a menu item
To quickly navigate to the required registry in the System, create a new menu item. To do this, go to the
menu settings
and create a menu item of the "Registry" type. In the profile of its creation it is necessary to fill in the name and identifier of the object, necessarily indicating the object type based on which the registry is built and select the configured registry.
If the field is filled in and the user has
permissions
to the specified basic registry, then:
if the user has selected a different
basic registry
or a child of it by default, the basic registry specified in the “Registry” field will be displayed;
if the user has selected
custom registry
by default, a child of the one specified in the “Registry” field - the default custom registry will be displayed.
If the user does not have
permissions
to the basic registry specified in the “Registry” field or the “Registry” field is not filled in, the default registry will be displayed.
To set a registry to "default", display the entire list of registries and click on the
button to the left of the name.
Access to the basic registry
It is important to ensure that all users who will work with the created copy of the registry are granted access. To do this, go to the menu item "Access to system objects", specify the object type "Basic registry settings", select the necessary registry and assign the necessary permissions to the appropriate user group.
After assigning the necessary permissions, make sure to save the changes.
Custom registry
The distinguishing feature of the custom registry from the basic registry is that in case the user does not have permissions to edit the basic registry, the user cannot create a copy of it - instead, the window of creating a custom registry with a filled in link to the object type opens.
To create a new custom registry, display the list of existing registries using the
button. In the list that opens, select the basic registry and click on the
button.
Similar to setting up the basic registry, basic information needs to be entered:
Registry
name
;
Object type
based on which the registry is created (can be filled in automatically).
After saving the changes, the user registry will be displayed on the screen, located at the second level of the hierarchical list of existing registries.
It is important to note that in the process of creating a custom registry, the user cannot make changes that relate to data visualization. These settings are possible only after the registry is created.
To be able to edit attribute values directly in the object type registry, open the registry settings, go to the "Display styles" tab and activate the "Use default editing mode" setting switch.
Once this is done, it is possible to change the attribute values in the registry by clicking once with the left mouse button on the field to be edited.
Creating a menu item
The process of creating a menu item to quickly navigate to a custom registry is similar to creating a menu item for a basic registry, however, there is one difference: the user does not have the option to specify a custom registry in the "Registry" field, while only the basic ones are available.
Access to the custom registry
If there is a need to grant access to the user registry to certain users or groups of users, it is required to assign them the necessary permissions. To do this, go to the menu item "Access to system objects", specify the object type "Custom registry settings", select the necessary registry and assign the necessary permissions to the appropriate user group.
